trial_identification.studytitle: A Single Ascending And Multiple Ascending Dose Study of RO5271983 in Healthy Volunteers
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Phase 1 Placebo-controlled, Randomized, Observer-blind Combined Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of RO5271983 in Healthy Subjects.

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Placebo - MAD Treatment: drugs - Placebo - SAD Treatment: drugs - RO5271983 - MAD Treatment: drugs - RO5271983 - SAD
Experimental: 1 -
Experimental: 2 -
Placebo Comparator: 3 -
Placebo Comparator: 4 -
Treatment: drugs: Placebo - MAD Once or twice daily doses of matching placebo to RO5271983 for 14 days
Treatment: drugs: Placebo - SAD Single dose of matching placebo to RO5271983 for up to 3 periods
Treatment: drugs: RO5271983 - MAD Once or twice daily doses of RO5271983 for 14 days
Treatment: drugs: RO5271983 - SAD Single dose of RO5271983 at each period (for up to 3 periods)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Single ascending dose (SAD): Pharmacokinetics (plasma concentration) of RO5271983
Single ascending dose (SAD): Safety (incidence of adverse events)
Single ascending dose (SAD): Tolerability (e.g. vital signs)
Multiple ascending doses (MAD): Pharmacokinetics (plasma concentration) of RO5271983
Multiple ascending doses (MAD): Safety (incidence of adverse events)
Multiple ascending doses (MAD): Tolerability (e.g. vital signs)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Effect of food on pharmacokinetics of RO5271983
Single ascending dose (SAD): Pharmacodynamics (blood analysis) of RO5271983
Multiple ascending doses (MAD): Pharmacodynamics (blood analysis) of RO5271983

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Healthy volunteers, 18-65 years of age
- Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18 and 32 kg/m2, inclusive
- In the SAD, females subjects must be surgically sterile or post-menopausal for the past year; in the MAD females may be of child-bearing potential but must use 2 methods of highly effective contraception
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- A history of clinically relevant cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, endocrine, pulmonary, neurological, psychiatric, allergic or skin disease
- Clinical significant abnormalities in laboratory test results
- Symptoms of an infectious disease including upper respiratory tract infection within one month of study start or a history of recurrent infections
- Smokers of >5 cigarettes/day within 3 months prior to admission and unable to stop smoking during study

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This placebo-controlled, randomized, observer-blind, dose-ascending study will investigate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of single and multiple doses of RO5271983 in healthy volunteers. Healthy volunteers will be randomized to receive either a single oral dose of RO5271983 or placebo in the SAD part or multiple oral doses of RO5271983 or placebo in the MAD part. The anticipated time on study treatment is approximately 14 weeks for the SAD part and up to 8 weeks for the MAD part.
